answerText: G proteins[10] These small G proteins lack a certain arginine residue that prevent them from inactivating, therefore they have been implicated in several cell cycle and cancer problems.
heading: MAGNI |2011 | 1 | 19 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Phosducin prevents one portion of one of these proteins from binding to another. For 10 points each: [10] Identify these usually heterotrimeric proteins whose alpha subunits dissociate from the beta-gamma and target other effectors when a signal is transmitted to them through a namesake coupled receptor.
